title.value: An Empirical Study on Bugs Inside PyTorch: A Replication Study
title.justification: Exact title extracted from the provided text.
title.quote: An Empirical Study on Bugs Inside PyTorch: A Replication Study

extractions.description: This paper replicates a study done on the TensorFlow deep learning library by analyzing bugs found in PyTorch. It characterizes the symptoms and root causes of these bugs, identifies components prone to bugs, and outlines repair patterns.

type.justification: The paper performs an empirical analysis by manually inspecting and classifying bugs in the PyTorch library.
type.quote: In this paper, we replicate the study conducted by Jia et al. [10] on the PyTorch library [3], another popular Python library for developing deep learning systems.

name.justification: The paper focuses on identifying, classifying, and analyzing bugs in a deep learning software library.
name.quote: Our goal in this study is to better understand the characteristic of bugs in DL libraries and their respective bug-fixing practices.

name.justification: The paper conducts an empirical study on bugs in software.
name.quote: Our contributions in this paper are as follows: • We study 194 bugs in the popular DL library PyTorch to understand the bug characteristics and how the bugs are fixed.

name.justification: The paper discusses repair patterns which can be useful for automated program repair strategies.
name.quote: Recurring fix patterns can be useful to devise automated strategies.

name.justification: The entire study revolves around analyzing bugs in the PyTorch library.
name.quote: In this paper, we replicate the study conducted by Jia et al. [10] on the PyTorch library [3], another popular Python library for developing deep learning systems.

referenced_paper_title.value: PyTorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the primary reference for the PyTorch library used in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: A. Paszke, S. Gross, F. Massa, A. Lerer, J. Bradbury, G. Chanan, T. Killeen, Z. Lin, N. Gimelshein, L. Antiga et al., 'PyTorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library,' Advances in neural information processing systems, vol. 32, 2019.

name.justification: TensorFlow is mentioned multiple times for comparison with PyTorch regarding bug characteristics.
name.quote: Two studies from Jia et al. [10], [11] pioneered an investigation on bugs inside the TensorFlow library.

referenced_paper_title.value: TensorFlow: A system for Large-Scale machine learning
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the primary reference for the TensorFlow library, which is compared to PyTorch in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: M. Abadi, P. Barham, J. Chen, Z. Chen, A. Davis, J. Dean, M. Devin, S. Ghemawat, G. Irving, M. Isard et al., '{TensorFlow}: A system for {Large-Scale} machine learning,' in 12th USENIX symposium on operating systems design and implementation (OSDI 16), 2016, pp. 265–283.
